text: West Bengal: Indian zoo ordered to change lions’ 'blasphemous' names 5 Articles 5 Articles [NDTV 7 minutes ago·New Delhi, IndiaRead Full Article] "Why Name Them Akbar, Sita?": High Court Asks Bengal To Rename Lions The Calcutta High Court on Thursday asked the West Bengal government to rename the lion "Akbar" and lioness "Sita", whose names caused a controversy after both animals were placed in the same enclosure at the Bengal Safari Park in Siliguri. [WION 2 hours ago·Noida, IndiaRead Full Article] Indian court raps West Bengal govt over naming lions 'Akbar, Sita' The government in the Indian state of West Bengal was instructed by the Calcutta High Court to rename the lions who have been named "Akbar" and "Sita” after the names caused a controversy. Both the lions were kept in the same enclosure at the Bengal Safari Park in Siliguri.
